Description: Rim and body sherd of North Ionian Late Wild goat Style pottery plate; pale slip; interior: key maeander frieze between broad bands with added red bands lined in white; part of lotus and bud frieze to centre; exterior: brown fired band on edge of rim; three bands on wall.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Ure Museum of Greek Archaeology, Reading. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Possibly originally from a stemmed dish.
Bibliographic references: CVA Reading I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain, Fasc. 12, University of Reading (p. 34, pl. 21, no. 30a-b)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.714)
